dedicatedCounters¶

AnalogInputCalibration¶

Created on Thu Mar 14 09:26:25 2013

@author: wolverine Analog Input calibrations to create a new calibration derive a new class from AnalogInputCalibration, overwrite the necessary functions and add the new class to AnalogInputCalibrationMap

AutoLoad¶

Created on Fri Apr 12 23:45:54 2013

@author: pmaunz

This is the GUI for the autoload program. Includes start/stop button for loading, a record of all loads, and an interlock to the laser frequencies returned by the wavemeter.

class AutoLoad(config, dbConnection, pulser, dataAvailableSignal, globalVariablesUi, externalInstrumentObservable, parent=None)[source]¶
adjustFromLoading()[source]¶
adjustToLoading()[source]¶
autoSave()[source]¶
checkFreqsInRange()[source]¶

Check whether all laser frequencies being used by the interlock are in range.

If they are not, loading is stopped/prevented, and the lock status bar turns from green to red. If the lock is not being used, the status bar is black.

onStart()[source]¶

Execute when start button is clicked. Begin loading if idle.

onStateChanged(name, state)[source]¶
onStop()[source]¶

Execute when stop button is clicked. Stop loading.

onTimer()[source]¶

Execute whenever the timer sends a timeout signal, which is every 100 ms. Trigger status changes based on elapsed time. This controls the flow of the loading process.

onTrappedIonNow()[source]¶
onUseInterlockClicked()[source]¶

Run if useInterlock button is clicked. Change settings to match.

onValueChanged(attr, value)[source]¶

Change the value of attr in settings to value

onWavemeterData(channel, reply)[source]¶

Execute when reply is received from the wavemeter. Display it on the GUI, and check whether it is in range.

onWavemeterError(channel, reply, error)[source]¶

Print out received error

Execute when count rate goes over threshold.

setCoolingOven()[source]¶
setDisabled(disable)[source]¶
setDisappeared()[source]¶
setFrozen()[source]¶
setIdle()[source]¶

Execute when the loading process is set to idle. Disable timer, do not pay attention to the count rate, and turn off the ionization laser and oven.

setLoad()[source]¶

Execute after preheating. Turn on ionization laser, and begin monitoring count rate.

setPostSequenceWait()[source]¶
setPreheat()[source]¶

Execute when the loading process begins. Turn on timer, turn on oven.

setProfile(name, profile)[source]¶
setShuttleCheck()[source]¶

Execute when count rate goes over threshold.

setShuttleLoad()[source]¶

Execute after preheating. Turn on ionization laser, and begin monitoring count rate.
